page.title: 14Lochore Miners Welfare Inst.
page.content: The Institute was opened in 1934 by the Coal Industry Social Welfare Organisation (CISWO). Clubs like these were opened all over Scotland. Lochore Institute was licensed in 1958. The colliery in the area at that time was the MARY PIT so the gala was known as the{MARY PIT GALA.}In 1967 it became an open gala as the club membership became available to people outwith the coal industry. The gala is for all members and their families. It is financed by a yearly membership of Â£2.25 for non-mining members, and members in the mining industry have a weekly deduction from their pay of about 8-10p. Membership fees cover Christmas parties, galas, old folks treats and hire of the hall for weddings etc. at a reduced fee. The gala takes place at 'The Big House' (Lochore House). Alan Shields (11)
